title: Ancient Magicks

properties.name: description
properties.value: Ancient Magicks (also known as Ancients) are a series of Magic spells unlocked upon completion of the quest Desert Treasure. Unlike the Lunar spellbook, which primarily focuses on utility spells, and the standard spellbook, which is a mixture of combat and utility spells, the Ancient Magicks is significantly combat-oriented, including some of the most powerful combat spells in the game.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Ancient Magicks
"Ancients" redirects here. For other uses, see Ancient.
The Ancient Magicks spellbook.

Ancient Magicks (also known as Ancients) are a series of Magic spells unlocked upon completion of the quest Desert Treasure. Unlike the Lunar spellbook, which primarily focuses on utility spells, and the standard spellbook, which is a mixture of combat and utility spells, the Ancient Magicks is significantly combat-oriented, including some of the most powerful combat spells in the game.

Having far fewer spells than the other spellbooks, the Ancient Magicks only contains 16 combat spells and nine teleports. Many of the Ancient Magick spells are very rune-intensive and require expensive runes such as death and blood runes. Owing to their power (a minimum of 50 Magic is needed to even access the spellbook), Ancient Magick spells are popular in player-versus-player activities.

Contents

  • 1 Background
  • 2 Skill and quest requirements
  • 3 Switching spellbooks
    • 3.1 Reaching the pyramid
  • 4 Spell summary
    • 4.1 Autocasting
    • 4.2 Combat spells
    • 4.3 Teleportation spells
  • 5 Trivia

Background[edit | edit source]

The Ancient Magicks are a long forgotten and destructive set of spells. In the Second Age, they were very commonly used, mostly by the followers of Zaros, who ruled a very large empire at that time.

The destructive and powerful spells of the Ancient Magicks proved to be useful during the wars in the era. The Spellbook also contained various teleport spells, which made it easier for the Zarosians to travel across their empire, which stretched from the northern Wilderness, to northern Misthalin and north-western Morytania.

Unfortunately, knowledge of Runecraft was lost before the Second Age and the remaining supplies Guthix provided humans in the First Age slowly disappeared through the use of Magic. Back then, many wizards held battles with the few remaining runes as a prize.

After Zaros' banishment following the Betrayal of Zaros, Zamorak and other gods like Saradomin, destroyed the empire. The destruction of the empire and the slow disappearance of runes caused the Ancient Magicks to become a rarely used form of Magic. During this time, only the Mahjarrat used Ancient Magicks, mostly because they didn't need runes to use Magic.

The God Wars held after Zaros' banishment saw the slow fade of the Ancient Magicks from common knowledge. Many of the remaining followers of Zaros, who comprised the majority of spell-casters, were killed or imprisoned. The powerful spells caused much destruction during the enormous battles, although the number of people who knew about the spells was extremely limited.

Long after the end of the God Wars, at the beginning of the Fifth Age, the art of Runecraft was rediscovered, giving humans a new supply of runes. New spells were invented by modern wizards of the Wizards' Tower, driving the Ancient Magicks even further into obscurity. Today, Ancient Magicks are used almost exclusively by the Mahjarrat, who have been driven close to extinction in Gielinor. A handful of people, such as Solus Dellagar, still possess the knowledge of Ancient Magicks. But furthermore, most mages of Gielinor choose to practice the modern magic created at the Wizards' Tower. Players will learn about the Ancient Magicks during the Desert Treasure quest, where they release the imprisoned Zarosian Mahjarrat Azzanadra.

Skill and quest requirements[edit | edit source]

Because unlocking the Ancient Magicks spellbook requires completion of the Desert Treasure quest, the following quests are also required:

Total level: 332
33 ---- ----
30 15 20
---- 10 ----
40 53 ----
11 ---- 50
50 10 ----
---- 10 ----
---- ----
28 ---- ----
  • The Dig Site
  • The Tourist Trap
  • Temple of Ikov
  • Priest in Peril
  • Troll Stronghold
  • Waterfall Quest
  • Druidic Ritual

Because of these quests, the skills required to obtain the Ancient Magicks can be seen in the table to the right.

Switching spellbooks[edit | edit source]

Once Desert Treasure is completed, the easiest way to switch spellbooks for normal accounts is to use another player's POH. To find a house to use, use the Grouping interface and select "player owned houses" from the drop-down and use the Clan Chat to find a house with either an Ancient altar or an Occult altar. Most players who have houses publicly open will use the portals in Yanille & Rimmington. Keep in mind that this method will not work for Ironman Mode.

Players can switch to Ancient Magicks at the altar inside the Jaldraocht Pyramid (simply "Pyramid" on the World Map) in the Kharidian Desert, south-west of Pollnivneach and north of Menaphos. There is a rear entrance (tunnel) to the south of the pyramid that allows players who have completed Desert Treasure to enter the throne room directly, where the altar resides, without having to navigate the four floors of the pyramid. At the altar, players can pray to switch to or from the Ancient Magicks spellbook, though this drains all Prayer points to zero (players can still switch spellbooks even with 0 Prayer points).

Those who simply wish to switch from Ancient Magicks to the regular spellbook may find it easier to pray twice at the Astral Altar on Lunar Isle, provided Lunar Diplomacy has been completed. Alternatively, players may also switch spellbooks twice with Tyss at the Dark Altar (easily reached with fairy ring code CIS if the player has activated it), provided they have 100% Arceuus favour.

Players who have level 80 in Construction can build an ancient altar within their Achievement Gallery, allowing them to freely switch between the standard and ancient spellbooks without the prayer drain.

Additionally, players who have level 99 in Magic can switch their spellbook up to five times per day with the Magic cape.

Reaching the pyramid[edit | edit source]

Various methods of teleportation exist for reaching the Jaldraocht Pyramid:

  • The pharaoh's sceptre, obtained from Pyramid Plunder, teleports players directly on top of the pyramid.
  • A camulet provides a teleport to Enahkra's temple, which is just west of Jaldraocht Pyramid.
  • Ferryman Sathwood can transport a player to the Ruins of Unkah, which is just south of Jaldraocht Pyramid.
  • Pollnivneach is a short distance east of the Pyramid and it is accessible via the magic carpet network (from either Shantay Pass or Sophanem, after Icthlarin's Little Helper), or Teleport to House for players who have their houses located in Pollnivneach.
  • Fairy ring code DLQ and run south to Nardah and run west till the bridge and cross it and you would see the Jaldraocht Pyramid.

Spell summary[edit | edit source]

Autocasting[edit | edit source]

Unlike the standard spells, Ancient Magicks combat spells can only be autocast with particular Magic weapons. The weapons are:

Staff
Ancient staff
Ahrim's staff[n 1]
Master wand
Kodai wand
Nightmare staff
Eldritch nightmare staff
Volatile nightmare staff
  1. ↑ With Ahrim the Blighted's equipment and the Amulet of the damned

Combat spells[edit | edit source]

The Ancient Magicks combat spells are, as mentioned, the most dangerous combat spells in the game. Not only can they deal a substantial amount of damage, but each of the four classes of combat spells has a different additional effect:

A mage casts Ice Barrage on several foes.
  • The Smoke spells are the only group of spells that can inflict poison damage to other players and NPCs.
  • The Shadow spells can be used to lower the target's Attack level.
    • Shadow spells can also disorient the Abyssal Sire during its first phase.
  • The Blood spells will heal the caster 25% of the damage dealt.
  • The Ice spells freeze the target in place and prevent it from moving.

The specific duration/effectiveness of each of the standard effects (aside from the blood spells, which always heal a flat 25%) depends on the level of the spell cast; for example, Smoke Burst will deal more poison damage than Smoke Rush. In addition, the Burst and Barrage spells are area-of-effect spells, which will hit the target and any other player or NPC standing in a 3x3 zone around the target in a multicombat area. The Rush and Blitz spells only hit a single target.

Some monsters are large, meaning that they take up more than one square of space. When a Burst or Barrage spell is cast on one of these monsters, it will hit the monster plus any surrounding monsters with any square of space standing within a 3x3 zone of the targeted monster's southwestern-most corner square, which is treated as its "origin" square.

While less popular for general training, Ancient Magicks is often used in various player-versus-player activities, such as the TzHaar Fight Pit and Castle Wars. Ice spells, specifically Ice Burst and Ice Barrage, are especially popular, due to their freezing effects and lower cost when compared to other combat spells.

Ancient Magicks are not allowed in Barbarian Assault.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes Coins[1] XP Base Max hit[2] Effect
Smoke Rush 50 1 1 2 2 514 30 13 Poisons target starting at 2 damage.
Shadow Rush 52 1 2 2 1 662 31 14 Reduces target's Attack level by 10%.
Blood Rush 56 1 2 2 816 33 15 Heals the caster for 25% of the damage inflicted on the target.
Ice Rush 58 2 2 2 514 34 16 Freezes the target for 5 seconds.
Smoke Burst 62 2 2 4 2 652 36 17 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Poisons targets starting at 2 damage.
Shadow Burst 64 1 4 2 2 938 37 18 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Reduces targets' Attack levels by 10% each.
Blood Burst 68 2 4 2 1,256 39 21 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Heals the caster for 25% of the damage inflicted on the targets.
Ice Burst 70 4 4 2 652 40 22 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Freezes targets for 10 seconds.
Smoke Blitz 74 2 2 2 2 1,020 42 23 Poisons target starting at 4 damage.
Shadow Blitz 76 2 2 2 2 1,316 43 24 Reduces target's Attack level by 15%.
Blood Blitz 80 4 2 1,624 45 25 Heals the caster for 25% of the damage inflicted on the target.
Ice Blitz 82 3 2 2 1,015 46 26 Freezes target for 15 seconds.
Smoke Barrage 86 4 4 2 4 1,416 48 27 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Poisons targets starting at 4 damage.
Shadow Barrage 88 4 2 4 3 1,855 49 28 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Reduces targets' Attack levels by 15%.
Blood Barrage 92 4 4 1 2,153 51 29 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Heals the caster for 25% of the damage inflicted on the targets.
Ice Barrage 94 6 2 4 1,406 52 30 Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Freezes targets for 20 seconds.
  1. ↑ Price will vary when using Combination runes.
  2. ↑ Max hit may be increased by using equipment which increases magic damage.

Teleportation spells[edit | edit source]

A player teleporting with Ancient Magicks.

Teleport spells from the Ancient Magicks teleport players to former strongholds and settlements of the Zarosian Empire, some of which are located in the Wilderness.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Notes
Edgeville Home Teleport 0 None 0 Teleports the player to Edgeville, near the well. Using this spell takes around 10 seconds to cast, gives no experience, and is interruptible by combat. Players can only cast this spell once every 30 minutes.
Paddewwa Teleport 54 1 1 2 64 Teleports the player inside the entrance of Edgeville Dungeon.
Senntisten Teleport 60 2 1 70 Teleports the player to the Digsite, between the south gate and the Exam Centre.
Kharyrll Teleport 66 1 2 76 Teleports the player to Canifis, inside the Hair of the Dog tavern.
Lassar Teleport 72 4 2 82 Teleports the player to the top of Ice Mountain, towards the south side of the snowy area.
Dareeyak Teleport 78 2 3 2 88 Teleports the player to the western ruins in the Wilderness.
Carrallangar Teleport 84 2 2 94 Teleports the player to the Graveyard of Shadows in the Wilderness.
Teleport to Target 85 1 1 1 45 Teleports the player to an assigned target in the Wilderness. Can only be cast on target worlds.
Annakarl Teleport 90 2 2 100 Teleports the player to the Demonic Ruins in the Wilderness.
Ghorrock Teleport 96 8 2 106 Teleports the player to the Frozen Waste Plateau in the Wilderness.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Mind, earth, astral, cosmic, nature, wrath and body runes are not used in the Ancient Magicks spellbook.
  • Of the various combination runes, only smoke runes are useful for Ancient Magicks, as the Smoke spells and Paddewwa and Dareeyak Teleports are the only spells to use more than one elemental rune.
  • If your membership expires while the Ancient Magicks spellbook is activated, then it will return to the regular spellbook, even if you re-activate your membership.
  • Despite being a members only spellbook, the Edgeville Home Teleport is available in any Free-to-play world, as long as your membership is still active.

Alternatively, players may also switch spellbooks twice with [[Tyss]] at the [[Dark Altar]] (easily reached with [[fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|CIS}} if the player has activated it), provided they have 100% [[Arceuus]] favour. Players who have level 80 in [[Construction]] can build an [[ancient altar]] within their [[Achievement Gallery]], allowing them to freely switch between the standard and ancient spellbooks without the prayer drain. Poisons targets starting at 4 damage. |- |[[File:Shadow Barrage.png]] |[[File:Shadow Barrage icon (mobile).png]] |[[Shadow Barrage]] |88 |{{RuneReq|Air=4|Soul=3|Blood=2|Death=4}} |{{NoCoins|{{GEP|Death rune}}*4 + {{GEP|Soul rune}}*3 + {{GEP|Air rune}}*4 + {{GEP|Blood rune}}*2 }} |49 |28 | style="text-align: left;" | Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Reduces targets' [[Attack]] levels by 15%. |- |[[File:Blood Barrage.png]] |[[File:Blood Barrage icon (mobile).png]] |[[Blood Barrage]] |92 |{{RuneReq|Death=4|Blood=4|Soul=1}} |{{NoCoins|{{GEP|Death rune}}*4 + {{GEP|Soul rune}}*1 + {{GEP|Blood rune}}*4 }} |51 |29 | style="text-align: left;" | Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Heals the caster for 25% of the damage inflicted on the targets. |- |[[File:Ice Barrage.png]] |[[File:Ice Barrage icon (mobile).png]] |[[Ice Barrage]] |94 |{{RuneReq|Death=4|Blood=2|Water=6}} |{{NoCoins|{{GEP|Death rune}}*4 + {{GEP|Water rune}}*6 + {{GEP|Blood rune}}*2 }} |52 |30 | style="text-align: left;" | Hits a 3x3 area around a target. Freezes targets for 20 seconds. |} ===Teleportation spells=== [[File:Ancient teleport.gif|frame|A player teleporting with Ancient Magicks.]] Teleport spells from the Ancient Magicks teleport players to former strongholds and settlements of the [[Zarosian Empire]], some of which are located in the [[Wilderness]]. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:850px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]
icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP !Notes |- |[[File:Edgeville Home Teleport.png]] |[[File:Edgeville Home Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Edgeville Home Teleport]] |0 |None |0 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to [[Edgeville]], near the well. Using this spell takes around 10 seconds to cast, gives no [[experience]], and is interruptible by [[combat]]. Players can only cast this spell once every 30 minutes. |- |[[File:Paddewwa Teleport.png]] |[[File:Paddewwa Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Paddewwa Teleport]] |54 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Air=1|Fire=1}} |64 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player inside the entrance of [[Edgeville Dungeon]]. |- |[[File:Senntisten Teleport.png]] |[[File:Senntisten Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Senntisten Teleport]] |60 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Soul=1}} |70 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to the [[Digsite]], between the south gate and the Exam Centre. |- |[[File:Kharyrll Teleport.png]] |[[File:Kharyrll Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Kharyrll Teleport]] |66 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Blood=1}} |76 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to [[Canifis]], inside the [[Hair of the Dog]] tavern. |- |[[File:Lassar Teleport.png]] |[[File:Lassar Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Lassar Teleport]] |72 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Water=4}} |82 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to the top of [[Ice Mountain]], towards the south side of the snowy area. |- |[[File:Dareeyak Teleport.png]] |[[File:Dareeyak Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Dareeyak Teleport]] |78 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Air=2|Fire=3}} |88 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to the [[Ruins (west)|western ruins]] in the [[Wilderness]]. |- |[[File:Carrallangar Teleport.png]] |[[File:Carrallangar Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Carrallangar Teleport]] |84 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Soul=2}} |94 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to the [[Graveyard of Shadows]] in the [[Wilderness]]. |- |[[File:Teleport to Target.png]] |[[File:Teleport to Target icon (mobile).png]] |[[Teleport to Target]] |85 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Death=1|Chaos=1}} |45 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to an assigned target in the Wilderness. Can only be cast on target worlds. |- |[[File:Annakarl Teleport.png]] |[[File:Annakarl Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Annakarl Teleport]] |90 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Blood=2}} |100 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to the [[Demonic Ruins]] in the [[Wilderness]]. |- |[[File:Ghorrock Teleport.png]] |[[File:Ghorrock Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Ghorrock Teleport]] |96 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Water=8}} |106 | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to the [[Frozen Waste Plateau]] in the [[Wilderness]]. |} {{Reflist}} ==Trivia== *[[Mind rune|Mind]], [[earth rune|earth]], [[astral rune|astral]], [[cosmic rune|cosmic]], [[nature rune|nature]], [[Wrath rune|wrath]] and [[body rune]]s are not used in the Ancient Magicks spellbook. *Of the various [[combination rune]]s, only [[smoke rune]]s are useful for Ancient Magicks, as the [[Smoke spells]] and [[Paddewwa Teleport|Paddewwa]] and [[Dareeyak Teleport]]s are the only spells to use more than one elemental rune. *If your [[membership]] expires while the Ancient Magicks spellbook is activated, then it will return to the [[regular spellbook]], even if you re-activate your membership. *Despite being a [[members]] only spellbook, the [[Edgeville Home Teleport]] is available in any [[Free-to-play world]], as long as your membership is still active. {{Spellbooks}} {{Ancient Magicks}}
